name: Readme
description: A text document describing the data/files available from the GigaDB FTP server for this dataset.

name: Methylome data
description: Determine cytosine methylation states in nucleic acid sequences.

name: Coding sequence
description: Predcited protein-coding regions (CDS or exon) or open reading frames in nucleotide sequences.

name: Protein sequence
description: One or more protein sequences, possibly with associated annotation. Usually translations of coding region predictions.

name: Annotation
description: This Is a broad concept and covers all files containing annotation of something, this could be sequence features, or image features or many other things. If possible a more specific type should be used.

name: Other
description: to be used when no appropriate file type is available

name: Genome sequence
description: nucleotide sequence file, these could be filtered or raw, but usually GigaDB only hosts processed sequence files, the raw should be deposited in the SRA

name: SNPs
description: A specific subset of sequence variants. Single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNP) and associated data, for example, the discovery and annotation of SNPs. A SNP is a DNA sequence variation where a single nucleotide differs between members of a species or paired chromosomes in an individual.

name: ISA-Tab
description: Files generated by the ISA-tools

name: Software
description: a file that is executable in some way, this includes files that are integral parts of other executable files (i.e. all files in a software package are included in this type.)

name: Alignments
description: An alignment of molecular sequences, structures or profiles derived from them.

name: Allele frequencies
description: The distribution of allele frequencies in a population of organisms

name: Haplotype map
description: A map of haplotypes in a genome or other sequence, describing common patterns of genetic variation.

name: Transcriptome sequence
description: nucleotide sequence of transcripts, either directly from RNA-seq or predicted from genome/transcriptome assembly data

name: Mass Spectrometry data
description: Data concerning a mass spectrometry measurement.

name: Multiple Reaction Monitoring (MRM)
description: Mass-spec Multiple Reaction Monitoring (MRM) file.

name: Text
description: free text

name: 16S rRNA
description: a file containing 16S rRNA sequence(s)

name: Image
description: Biological or biomedical data has been rendered into an image, typically for display on screen.

name: Video
description: includes traditional camera movies as well as a sequence of image files concatenated to form a moving image, usually cross-sectional study of an organism or molecule.

name: MicroCT
description: File generated by/from micro_computed tomography

name: DarwinCore
description: Metadata information about the sample and/or study, conforming to Darwin Core set of standards, usually in tabular format (CSV).

name: HTML
description: a Hypertext Markup Language file, usually linking other GigaDB files together in a human readable/navigatable format

name: Directory
description: The name of a directory containing one or more files, usually the directory name will provide some indication of the content (either sample name or data type).

name: MD5sum
description: the MD5 checksum value of file (or list of files), used to determine fidelity of file transfer, particularly useful for large files.
edam_ontology_id: not in EDAM, it should be a subset of "Nucleic acid sequence(data:2977, EDAM)"

name: Galaxy workflow
description: the workflow file generated by Galaxy tools

name: Article
description: A document of scientific text, for example; a full text article from a scientific journal, or a supplemental file, or even formal unpublished documentation of software/scripts

name: Repeat sequence
description: This includes long terminal repeats (LTRs); sequences (typically retroviral) directly repeated at both ends of a defined sequence and other types of repeating unit. Repetitive elements within a nucleic acid sequence.

name: BLAST
description: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of BLAST. This includes score data, alignment data and summary table.

name: EEG
description: electroencephalography/event-related potentials (EEG/ERP) data

name: Amplicon sequence
description: sequence of a particular amplicon, usually a marker gene, from one or more samples or microbiomes

name: Script
description: includes text files of command lines used to run software applications, as well as more complex scripts such as R, perl and python scripts.

name: Optical map
description: a file containing optical map data, usually a TSV file of restriction enzyme fragment lengths (estimated by an optical mapping tool such as Argus)

name: Mixed archive
description: a compressed file containing a collection of data files of mixed types

name: GitHub archive
description: a compressed file containing all the files available from a particular GitHub repo on a particular date (usually taken at the time of review of the associated manuscript)

name: Expression data
description: Files representing the analysis of levels and patterns of synthesis of gene products (proteins and/or functional RNA) including interpretation in functional terms of gene expression data.

name: Structural variation
description: Variation in chromosome structure including microscopic and submicroscopic types of variation such as deletions, duplications, copy-number variants, insertions, inversions and translocations.

name: Sequence variants
description: Data on gene sequence variations resulting large-scale genotyping and DNA sequencing projects.

name: Phylogenetic tree
description: The raw data (not just an image) from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted, such as topology, lengths (in time or in expected amounts of variance) and a confidence interval for each length.

name: Tabular data
description: Tabular data represented as tab-separated values in a text file.

name: Sequence assembly
description: An assembly of fragments of a (typically genomic) DNA sequence. Typically, an assembly is a collection of contigs (for example ESTs and genomic DNA fragments) that are ordered, aligned and merged. Annotation of the assembled sequence might be included.

name: External link
description: a URL link to an external resource, this could be the actual location stored in GigaDB, or the URL(s) pasted into a text document and hosted in GigaDB.

name: Metadata
description: generic file type containing metadata - information about the sample, subject, software, file(s) and/or study.
